thread.title: WATCH: How David Warner got a life on 20 after being bowled off a no-ball during 1st India-Australia Test | Zee News
thread.title_full: WATCH: How David Warner got a life on 20 after being bowled off a no-ball during 1st India-Australia Test | Zee News

title: WATCH: How David Warner got a life on 20 after being bowled off a no-ball during 1st India-Australia Test | Zee News
text:
Follow @ZeeNewsSports 
Pune: Australian opener David Warner, one of the players to watch out for in the four-match series against India, saw plenty of action during the morning session on Day 1 of the first Test match against Australia at Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium. 
The dynamic left-hander, along with other opener Matthew Renshaw, provided a brilliant 82-run opening stand to the Aussies before being bowled by Umesh Yadav at the score of 38. 
ALSO READ : Why two new batsmen came to the crease after Umesh Yadav dismissed David Warner? 
Warner was pretty fortunate early in the innings when he was bowled by Jayant Yadav, although off a no-ball. Bowling his fourth over, Jayant bowled Warner round the legs, but the celebration immediately turned into disappointment after the umpire called it a no-ball. 
Watch the incident here: 
However, Warner could not make the best of the opportunity as he was bowled by Umesh Yadav. 
Considering the number of cracks present on the pitch, skipper Virat Kohli introduced R Ashwin in the second over of the innings. Warner and Renshaw looked vulnerable against the spinners, but negated the spin with some aggressive shots. First Published: Thursday, February 23, 2017 - 12:12 More from zeenews
